parameters.definition: Amount of ice cream produced by the counter-top sized machine per day
Amount of ice cream produced by the fridge sized machine per day
Heat output by the counter-top sized machine
Heat output by the fridge sized machine
Maximum allowable heat output per day
Minimum required ice cream production per day

description: An ice cream store can buy two machines, a counter-top sized one and a fridge sized one, to make ice cream. The counter-top sized one can produce \param{ProdCountertop} cones worth of ice cream every day while the fridge sized one can produce \param{ProdFridge} cones worth of ice cream every day. The counter-top sized machine outputs \param{HeatCountertop} units of heat while the fridge sized one outputs \param{HeatFridge} units of heat. The ice cream store can output at most \param{MaxHeat} units of heat per day and must produce at least \param{MinProd} cones worth of ice cream. How many of each machine should they buy to minimize the total number of machines needed?
